description: Use to associate an Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository or a repository managed by Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections with Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer. When you associate a repository, CodeGuru Reviewer reviews source code changes in the repository's pull requests and provides automatic recommendations. You can view recommendations using the CodeGuru Reviewer console. For more information, see Recommendations in Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer in the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer User Guide. If you associate a CodeCommit or S3 repository, it must be in the same Amazon Web Services Region and Amazon Web Services account where its CodeGuru Reviewer code reviews are configured. Bitbucket and GitHub Enterprise Server repositories are managed by Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections to connect to CodeGuru Reviewer. For more information, see Associate a repository in the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer User Guide.

parameters.name: Repository
parameters.description: The repository to associate. CodeCommit (dict) --- Information about an Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository. The name of the Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository. For more information, see repositoryName in the Amazon Web Services CodeCommit API Reference. Bitbucket (dict) --- Information about a Bitbucket repository. The name of the third party source repository. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections connection. Its format is arn:aws:codestar-connections:region-id:aws-account_id:connection/connection-id. For more information, see Connection in the Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections API Reference. The owner of the repository. For a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket repository, this is the username for the account that owns the repository. For an S3 repository, this can be the username or Amazon Web Services account ID GitHubEnterpriseServer (dict) --- Information about a GitHub Enterprise Server repository. For an S3 repository, this can be the username or Amazon Web Services account ID S3Bucket (dict) --- Information about a repository in an S3 bucket. The name of the repository in the S3 bucket. The name of the S3 bucket used for associating a new S3 repository. It must begin with codeguru-reviewer-.

nested_params.name: CodeCommit
nested_params.description: Information about an Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository. For more information, see repositoryName in the Amazon Web Services CodeCommit API Reference.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the third party source repository.

nested_params.name: ConnectionArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections connection. Its format is arn:aws:codestar-connections:region-id:aws-account_id:connection/connection-id. For more information, see Connection in the Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections API Reference.

nested_params.name: Owner
nested_params.description: The owner of the repository. For a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket repository, this is the username for the account that owns the repository. For an S3 repository, this can be the username or Amazon Web Services account ID.

nested_params.name: GitHubEnterpriseServer
nested_params.description: Information about a GitHub Enterprise Server repository.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the third party source repository.

nested_params.name: ConnectionArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections connection. Its format is arn:aws:codestar-connections:region-id:aws-account_id:connection/connection-id. For more information, see Connection in the Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections API Reference.

nested_params.name: Owner
nested_params.description: The owner of the repository. For a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, or Bitbucket repository, this is the username for the account that owns the repository. For an S3 repository, this can be the username or Amazon Web Services account ID.

nested_params.name: S3Bucket
nested_params.description: Information about a repository in an S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the repository in the S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: BucketName
nested_params.description: The name of the S3 bucket used for associating a new S3 repository. It must begin with codeguru-reviewer-.

parameters.name: ClientRequestToken
parameters.description: Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer uses this value to prevent the accidental creation of duplicate repository associations if there are failures and retries. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: An array of key-value pairs used to tag an associated repository. A tag is a custom attribute label with two parts: A tag key (for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret). Tag keys are case sensitive. An optional field known as a tag value (for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name). Omitting the tag value is the same as using an empty string. Like tag keys, tag values are case sensitive. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: KMSKeyDetails
parameters.description: A KMSKeyDetails object that contains: The encryption option for this repository association. It is either owned by Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) ( AWS_OWNED_CMK) or customer managed ( CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK). The ID of the Amazon Web Services KMS key that is associated with this repository association. KMSKeyId (string) --- The ID of the Amazon Web Services KMS key that is associated with a repository association. EncryptionOption (string) --- The encryption option for a repository association. It is either owned by Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) ( AWS_OWNED_CMK) or customer managed ( CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK).

nested_items.name: RepositoryAssociation
nested_items.description: Information about the repository association.

nested_items.name: AssociationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the repository association.

nested_items.name: AssociationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) identifying the repository association.

nested_items.name: ConnectionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections connection. Its format is arn:aws:codestar-connections:region-id:aws-account_id:connection/connection-id. For more information, see Connection in the Amazon Web Services CodeStar Connections API Reference.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the repository.

nested_items.name: Owner
nested_items.description: The owner of the repository. For an Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository, this is the Amazon Web Services account ID of the account that owns the repository. For a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise Server, or Bitbucket repository, this is the username for the account that owns the repository. For an S3 repository, it can be the username or Amazon Web Services account ID.

nested_items.name: ProviderType
nested_items.description: The provider type of the repository association.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the repository association.

nested_items.name: Associating
nested_items.description: Setting up pull request notifications. This is required for pull requests to trigger a CodeGuru Reviewer review.
Setting up pull request notifications. This is required for pull requests to trigger a CodeGuru Reviewer review.

nested_items.name: StateReason
nested_items.description: A description of why the repository association is in the current state.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTimeStamp
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the repository association was last updated.

nested_items.name: CreatedTimeStamp
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the repository association was created.

nested_items.name: KMSKeyDetails
nested_items.description: A KMSKeyDetails object that contains:
The encryption option for this repository association. It is either owned by Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) ( AWS_OWNED_CMK) or customer managed ( CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK).
The ID of the Amazon Web Services KMS key that is associated with this repository association.

nested_items.name: S3RepositoryDetails
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of an S3 bucket and a CodeArtifacts object that contains the S3 object keys for a source code .zip file and for a build artifacts .zip file that contains .jar or .class files.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket used for associating a new S3 repository. It must begin with codeguru-reviewer-.

nested_items.name: CodeArtifacts
nested_items.description: A CodeArtifacts object. The CodeArtifacts object includes the S3 object key for a source code .zip file and for a build artifacts .zip file that contains .jar or .class files.

nested_items.name: SourceCodeArtifactsObjectKey
nested_items.description: The S3 object key for a source code .zip file. This is required for all code reviews.

nested_items.name: BuildArtifactsObjectKey
nested_items.description: The S3 object key for a build artifacts .zip file that contains .jar or .class files. This is required for a code review with security analysis. For more information, see Create code reviews with GitHub Actions in the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer User Guide.

nested_items.type: for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret
nested_items.description: A tag key (for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret). Tag keys are case sensitive.

nested_items.type: for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name
nested_items.description: An optional field known as a tag value (for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name). Omitting the tag value is the same as using an empty string. Like tag keys, tag values are case sensitive.
